byline.contributor: Chris Buckley reported from Hong Kong, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ELLEN BARRY

abstract: Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi tells reporters after talks with Chinese Premier Li Keqiang that both men agreed on 24 ways to improve relations between two countries; Modi notes he also said that Indian grievances over Chinese policies should be addressed, such as border disputes, trade imbalance and China's partnership with Pakistan.
lead_paragraph: After meeting with the Chinese premier in Beijing, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that improved relations would hinge on how China responds to Indian concerns.

headline.main: Modi Calls on China to Rethink Stances That Strain Ties to India
headline.print_headline: Modi Urges China to Rethink Policies That Strain Ties

snippet: After meeting with the Chinese premier in Beijing, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that improved relations would hinge on how China responds to Indian concerns.
